value: .  Located on Coventry Boulevard, this area is known for its shopping, restaurants and bars.  Once a haven for artists, the area has become more commercialized in recent years but still maintains some of its charm.

. Located on Lee Road between Scarborough and Superior, with most of the businesses between Corydon and East Derbyshire. This area is mainly known for its restaurants and bars. It also contains the newly-renovated main branch of the Cleveland Heights-University Heights library system.

content=A fairly-small park located right in the middle of Cleveland Heights, Cain Park has six tennis courts, a small kiddie pool, a basketball court, a sledding hill, and two performing-arts stages.

content=Located in the Coventry District, this restaurant offers a large selection of specialty vegetarian food as well as their famous french fries and shakes, in additional to traditional hamburgers and sandwiches.
content=Located in the Cedar-Lee District, this restaurant offers a large selection of fresh bread, sandwiches, salads, soups, pastries, and drinks.
content=Located in the Coventry District, this tavern is a popular hangout with local college students. Drinks are reasonably priced, the food isn't bad, and there really is a lizard.
- The major city that dominates the region, Cleveland has experienced a revival in recent years and offers numerous food, lodging and entertainment options.
- One of America's oldest planned communities, Shaker Heights offers parks, lakes, and some incredible architecture, as well as dining and hotel options.
